channel.title: "Two more hours..."
channel.description:
Those were the last words of my close friend's father before he passed on.
According to my friend, waking up at 4 am has been his mother's routine ever since his father was discharged from hospital (he was suffering from the final stage of lung cancer and depended on an oxygen mask (not so sure on that) for breathing). Anyway, 2 days ago, she woke up at the same time to discover her husband awake early and asked him why. He didn't respond with nothing but a mere "two more hours" so she assumed that he was asking her to sleep and wake up two hours later instead. Eventually she woke up to find him no longer wearing the oxygen mask - it was neatly put in place on the bedside table. Tried wakin' him up etc, but he didn't respond. He already passed away.
Yeah, so that was just a summary about the final moments of my friend's father's life. He was someone who smoked cigarettes heavily. As much as the last words were accurate, let's not turn this into a debate about religion!
tl;dr: Smoking kills.

Eh. Lung cancer kills.

But you have to blame the root cause:

Smoking causes lung cancer causes death
just like
person causes gun to fire causes death

And guns don’t kill people, people kill people.

Sorry about your friend’s family.[/quote]

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

TheBeanie:

2 of the girls i work with lose there father last year…and now they found out today that their mothers cancer has come back for the third time. doesnt look good for her

My aunt survived cancer 7 times over many, many years. She passed away the 8th time, but tell them there is hope! (plus this was all back in the dark ages of medicine, the 1990s)

item.title: "Two more hours..."
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:36, topic:373631”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=469636.msg3437459#msg3437459 date=1292867959]
I don’t really understand why people still start smoking. I’ve been in stressful situations, but I’ve never longed for a cigarette. So the only reason I can think of is to look cool, which should be a reason to deny any health care. That’s obviously an exaggeration, but at least it’s a better reason to deny an insurance then any other pre-existing condition.
[/quote]

Sure, deny us healthcare.

Also deny fat people and people who sustain injuries through any sort of non-life-sustaining activity that carries a risk.

So, footballers with broken ankles. Denied. You knew there was a risk of getting a broken ankle when you played football, you shouldn’t have done it.[/quote]

L2read: I said that it was an obvious exaggeration, yet a better reason to deny someone an insurance than denying someone with a hereditary disease, because you don’t have any influence on that.

BTW: I said deny an insurance, not health care.

Read full topic

item.title: "Two more hours..."
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Mopman:

Asbestos is forced upon you though, smoking is a choice.

Exactly. Smoking is a choice, and you know that there is a big chance that you’ll get lung cancer from it. If you prefer short-term pleasure over long-term health (which is quite human, I admit), then there’s no reason for people to care about you (which is a bit inhuman, I’ll admit that too).

I don’t really understand why people still start smoking. I’ve been in stressful situations, but I’ve never longed for a cigarette. So the only reason I can think of is to look cool, which should be a reason to deny any health care. That’s obviously an exaggeration, but at least it’s a better reason to deny an insurance then any other pre-existing condition.

Read full topic

item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Ollie:

Who the fuck smokes asbestos?

What? I never said anyone was smoking asbestos. I was responding to Mopman. He said that smoking is a likely, not definite cause of lung cancer. I was merely wondering if Mopman thought the same about asbestos, and that miners and others working with asbestos should stop whining and get back to work.

Too much tax money in tobacco to make it illegal.

item.title: "Two more hours..."
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:21, topic:373631”][quote author=Greeny link=topic=469636.msg3434936#msg3434936 date=1292691634]
They should replace tobacco with cannabis and see how many people die from lung cancer then.
[/quote]Xcept many people prefer tobacco over cannabis (and vice-versa). Two completely different products.[/quote]

Well, it’s an impossibility. It would never actually happen.

I just see it as a good hypothetical switch, you take a legal, poisonous substance and switch it for an illegal substance which we’re still learning about. Cannabis was a great choice because it’s got the most medicinal research published around it.

Ideally we should all start vaporising, whichever plant we use.

Read full topic
